questions.question: Tom has 5 red apples and 3 green apples. His friend Sarah, who is 10 years old, gives him 4 more apples. How many apples does Tom have now?
questions.hint: Add all the apples together. Sarah's age doesn't affect the count!

questions.question: A blue car travels 60 km in 2 hours. The car weighs 1,500 kg. What is the car's speed?
questions.hint: Speed = distance divided by time. The car's weight doesn't affect the calculation.

questions.question: Emma bought 6 pencils for $2 each. The shop opened at 9 AM and has 3 floors. How much did she spend?
questions.hint: Multiply the number of pencils by the price each. Shop details don't matter.

questions.question: There are 24 students in a class. 8 students wear glasses and 15 brought lunch. How many students don't wear glasses?
questions.hint: Subtract the glasses-wearers from the total. The lunch info is a distraction.

questions.question: A rectangle is 8 cm long and 5 cm wide. It's drawn on yellow paper. What is its perimeter?
questions.hint: Perimeter = 2 times (length + width). Paper color doesn't affect the shape.

questions.question: Jake has 15 marbles. His sister is 7 years old. He gives away 6 marbles. How many does he have left?
questions.hint: Start with what Jake has, subtract what he gives away. Sister's age is irrelevant.

questions.question: A book has 120 pages. The cover is blue and it costs $15. If you read 30 pages per day, how many days to finish?
questions.hint: Divide total pages by pages per day. Cover color and price don't matter.

questions.question: Maria has 3 cats and 2 dogs. She lives on Oak Street and is 12 years old. How many pets does she have?
questions.hint: Add cats and dogs together. Street and age are distractions.

questions.question: A pizza is cut into 8 slices. The pizza is pepperoni flavor and costs $16. If 3 slices are eaten, how many remain?
questions.hint: Start with total slices, subtract eaten slices. Flavor and cost don't matter.

questions.question: Sam runs 4 km each morning. He wears red shoes and starts at 6 AM. How far does he run in 5 days?
questions.hint: Multiply daily distance by number of days. Shoe color and start time are irrelevant.

questions.question: A tree is 12 meters tall. It's an oak tree planted 20 years ago. A bird sits 4 meters from the top. How high is the bird?
questions.hint: Subtract the distance from top from the total height. Tree type and age don't matter.

questions.question: Lisa bought 4 notebooks at $3 each. The store is on Main Street and has 50 employees. How much did she pay?
questions.hint: Multiply quantity by price per item. Store location and employees are distractions.

questions.question: A bus can carry 40 passengers. The bus is yellow and the driver's name is Bob. If 28 people are on board, how many empty seats?
questions.hint: Subtract current passengers from capacity. Color and driver's name don't matter.

questions.question: Ben has $25. He earns $10 mowing lawns on Saturday. His birthday is in March. How much money does he have now?
questions.hint: Add what he earns to what he had. Birthday month is irrelevant.

questions.question: A garden has 6 rows of flowers with 8 flowers in each row. The flowers are tulips and bloom in spring. How many flowers total?
questions.hint: Multiply rows by flowers per row. Flower type and season don't affect the count.

questions.question: Amy walked 2 km to school and 2 km back. She wore her blue backpack and met 5 friends. How far did she walk in total?
questions.hint: Add the distance there and back. Backpack color and friends are distractions.

questions.question: A movie is 90 minutes long. It stars Tom Hanks and was released in 2020. If you've watched 35 minutes, how much is left?
questions.hint: Subtract watched time from total time. Actor and release year don't matter.

questions.question: Peter has 18 toy cars. 6 are red, 7 are blue, and the rest are green. His room is on the second floor. How many green cars?
questions.hint: Total minus red minus blue equals green. Room location is irrelevant.

questions.question: A cake weighs 2 kg. It's chocolate flavored and was baked by grandma. If it's cut into 8 equal pieces, how much does each weigh?
questions.hint: Divide total weight by number of pieces. Convert kg to g if needed. Flavor and baker don't matter.

questions.question: There are 30 birds in a tree. The tree is in Central Park and is 50 years old. If 12 birds fly away, how many remain?
questions.hint: Subtract birds that leave from the starting count. Location and tree age are distractions.

questions.question: Kate reads 15 pages per hour. Her favorite author is J.K. Rowling. How many pages can she read in 3 hours?
questions.hint: Multiply pages per hour by number of hours. Favorite author doesn't affect speed.

questions.question: A box contains 36 chocolates. The box is square and has a red ribbon. If 4 children share equally, how many each?
questions.hint: Divide total chocolates by number of children. Box shape and ribbon are irrelevant.

questions.question: David's fish tank holds 50 liters. The tank is glass and sits near the window. He adds 12 liters of water. It had 30 liters. How full now?
questions.hint: Add the new water to what was already there. Material and location don't matter.

questions.question: A train has 8 carriages with 45 seats each. The train is blue and travels at 120 km/h. How many seats total?
questions.hint: Multiply carriages by seats per carriage. Color and speed are distractions.

questions.question: Sophie scored 85 on her math test and 90 on science. Her teacher's name is Mrs. Smith. What's her total score?
questions.hint: Add the two test scores together. Teacher's name is irrelevant.

questions.question: A pool is 25 m long. The water temperature is 28 degrees C. Tom swims 4 lengths. How far did he swim?
questions.hint: Multiply pool length by number of lengths. Water temperature doesn't affect distance.

questions.question: Lucy has 24 stickers. She got them at a party on Saturday. She gives 8 to her friend. How many does she have left?
questions.hint: Start with total, subtract what she gives away. When/where she got them doesn't matter.

questions.question: A square has sides of 7 cm. It's drawn in black ink on white paper. What is its area?
questions.hint: Area of square = side times side. Ink and paper colors are distractions.

questions.question: Mike bought 5 apples at 60 cents each. The apples are from California and are organic. How much did he spend?
questions.hint: Multiply quantity by price each. Origin and organic status don't affect cost.

questions.question: A class has 32 students. 14 are boys. The classroom is Room 204 on the first floor. How many are girls?
questions.hint: Total students minus boys equals girls. Room number and floor are irrelevant.

questions.question: A rope is 15 m long. It's made of nylon and is blue. If you cut off 6 m, how long is the remaining piece?
questions.hint: Subtract the cut length from the total. Material and color don't matter.

questions.question: Jenny baked 24 cookies. The oven was set to 180 degrees C. She gives 9 to neighbors. How many cookies does she have?
questions.hint: Start with total baked, subtract what she gives away. Oven temperature is irrelevant.

questions.question: A bag holds 20 candies. The bag is plastic and from the corner store. If Tom takes 7 candies, how many are left?
questions.hint: Total minus taken equals remaining. Bag material and store don't matter.

questions.question: Dad drives 45 km to work. His car is silver and he leaves at 7:30 AM. How far does he drive for a round trip?
questions.hint: Round trip means there and back - multiply one-way by 2. Car color and time are distractions.

questions.question: A shelf has 4 rows of books with 9 books per row. The shelf is wooden and brown. How many books total?
questions.hint: Multiply rows by books per row. Material and color are irrelevant.

questions.question: Sara has 50 beads. Her favorite color is purple. She uses 18 beads for a bracelet. How many beads are left?
questions.hint: Start with total, subtract what she uses. Favorite color doesn't affect the count.

questions.question: A bicycle costs $150. The bike is from Japan and has 21 gears. If Mark saves $25 per week, how many weeks to buy it?
questions.hint: Divide total cost by weekly savings. Origin and gears don't affect the calculation.

questions.question: A box weighs 8 kg. The box is cardboard and was shipped on Monday. If you have 3 boxes, what's the total weight?
questions.hint: Multiply weight per box by number of boxes. Material and shipping day are distractions.

questions.question: There are 60 minutes in an hour. Clocks can be digital or analog. How many minutes in 4 hours?
questions.hint: Multiply minutes per hour by number of hours. Clock types are irrelevant.

questions.question: Anna plants 5 seeds per pot. She uses brown pots from the garden center. If she has 7 pots, how many seeds does she need?
questions.hint: Multiply seeds per pot by number of pots. Pot color and source don't matter.

questions.question: A farmer has 48 chickens. The farm is 5 miles from town and has a red barn. If he sells 15 chickens, how many remain?
questions.hint: Subtract the sold chickens from the total. Distance and barn color are distractions.

questions.question: Tim has 7 baseball cards and buys 8 more. His favorite team is the Yankees. How many cards does he have now?
questions.hint: Add the new cards to what he already had. Favorite team is irrelevant.

questions.question: A bottle holds 2 liters of juice. The bottle is green and made of glass. How many ml is that?
questions.hint: 1 liter = 1,000 ml. Bottle color and material don't affect the conversion.

questions.question: There are 5 houses on a street. Each house has 4 windows. The houses were built in 1990. How many windows total?
questions.hint: Multiply houses by windows per house. Build year is irrelevant.

questions.question: Mom buys 3 bags of oranges with 6 oranges each. The oranges cost $4 per bag. How many oranges in total?
questions.hint: Multiply bags by oranges per bag. The price doesn't affect the count.

questions.question: A pencil is 19 cm long. The pencil is yellow and has an eraser. If 5 cm breaks off, how long is it now?
questions.hint: Subtract what breaks from the original length. Color and eraser are distractions.

questions.question: Jack earns $8 per hour. He works 5 hours on Tuesday. His boss is named Carol. How much does he earn?
questions.hint: Multiply hourly rate by hours worked. Boss's name is irrelevant.

questions.question: A basket has 27 strawberries. The basket is woven and costs $5. If Emma eats 9 strawberries, how many are left?
questions.hint: Subtract eaten from total. Basket material and cost don't matter.

questions.question: A rectangle has length 10 cm and width 4 cm. It's part of a math homework assignment. What is its area?
questions.hint: Area = length times width. The homework context is irrelevant.

questions.question: There are 36 crayons in a box. The crayons are non-toxic and the box is cardboard. If shared by 6 kids, how many each?
questions.hint: Divide total crayons by number of kids. Safety info and box material don't matter.

questions.question: A cat weighs 5 kg. The cat is orange and named Whiskers. A dog weighs 12 kg. How much more does the dog weigh?
questions.hint: Subtract cat's weight from dog's weight. Color and name are distractions.

questions.question: Sue has 42 stamps. She got them from her grandfather who is 70 years old. She gives away 17 stamps. How many left?
questions.hint: Subtract given away from total. Grandfather's age is irrelevant.

questions.question: A clock shows 3:15 PM. The clock is digital and silver. How many minutes until 4:00 PM?
questions.hint: Count minutes from 3:15 to 4:00. Clock type and color don't matter.

questions.question: Ryan drinks 6 glasses of water daily. Each glass holds 250 ml. He uses a blue cup. How much water per day?
questions.hint: Multiply glasses by ml per glass. Cup color is irrelevant.

questions.question: A shop sells 12 ice creams in the morning and 15 in the afternoon. The shop is on Beach Street. How many total?
questions.hint: Add morning and afternoon sales. Shop location doesn't affect the count.

questions.question: Max has 63 building blocks. He builds a tower using 28 blocks. His blocks are plastic and colorful. How many blocks unused?
questions.hint: Subtract used blocks from total. Block material and colors are distractions.

questions.question: A parking lot has 5 rows with 8 cars each. The lot is next to a mall and has security. How many cars total?
questions.hint: Multiply rows by cars per row. Location and security are irrelevant.

questions.question: Lily's ribbon is 80 cm long. The ribbon is satin and pink. She cuts off 25 cm. How long is the remaining ribbon?
questions.hint: Subtract cut portion from original length. Material and color don't matter.

questions.question: A toy costs $15. The toy is from China and is for ages 5+. If Dan has $50, how much change after buying it?
questions.hint: Subtract toy cost from money he has. Origin and age range are distractions.

questions.question: There are 7 days in a week. The week starts on Sunday in some countries. How many days in 6 weeks?
questions.hint: Multiply days per week by number of weeks. Week start day is irrelevant.

questions.question: A baker makes 56 muffins. He uses organic flour and works in the early morning. If he packs 8 per box, how many boxes?
questions.hint: Divide total muffins by muffins per box. Flour type and work time don't matter.

questions.question: Clara's garden is 9 m long and 6 m wide. She planted it in April. What is the perimeter?
questions.hint: Perimeter = 2 times (length + width). Planting month is irrelevant.

questions.question: A train travels 180 km in 3 hours. The train has 12 carriages and is painted green. What is its speed?
questions.hint: Speed = distance divided by time. Carriages and color are distractions.

questions.question: Oscar has 14 toy soldiers. His bedroom wall is blue. He gets 11 more for his birthday. How many soldiers now?
questions.hint: Add new toys to what he had. Wall color is irrelevant.

questions.question: A bottle cap collection has 125 caps. The collector started when he was 8. He gives 37 to a friend. How many left?
questions.hint: Subtract given away from total. Starting age doesn't affect the math.

questions.question: There are 45 students going on a field trip. The bus is air-conditioned. If each row seats 5, how many rows needed?
questions.hint: Divide students by seats per row. Air conditioning is irrelevant.

questions.question: Kevin's fish tank has 8 goldfish and 6 guppies. The tank has a filter and heater. How many fish total?
questions.hint: Add goldfish and guppies together. Tank equipment doesn't affect the count.

questions.question: A pizza parlor sold 23 pizzas on Friday and 31 on Saturday. The parlor has been open since 2005. Total pizzas sold?
questions.hint: Add both days' sales together. Opening year is irrelevant.

questions.question: Jane has 100 hair clips. She bought them online for $15. She loses 23 clips. How many clips remain?
questions.hint: Subtract lost clips from total. Purchase method and price don't matter.

questions.question: A school has 8 classrooms with 25 desks each. The school was founded in 1965. How many desks total?
questions.hint: Multiply classrooms by desks per room. School founding year is irrelevant.

questions.question: Mom's recipe needs 3 cups of flour. The flour is whole wheat and organic. She wants to triple the recipe. How many cups?
questions.hint: Multiply original amount by 3. Flour type doesn't affect the calculation.

questions.question: A parking meter shows 45 minutes remaining. The meter is solar-powered. If you add 30 more minutes, total time?
questions.hint: Add the additional time to remaining time. Power source is irrelevant.

questions.question: Leo collects 12 seashells each day at the beach. The beach is in Florida. How many in 4 days?
questions.hint: Multiply daily collection by number of days. Beach location doesn't matter.

questions.question: A bookshelf has 72 books. The shelf is mahogany and 6 feet tall. If arranged in 8 equal stacks, how many per stack?
questions.hint: Divide total books by number of stacks. Material and height are distractions.

questions.question: Tina's jump rope is 2 m long. The rope is purple and has wooden handles. How many cm is that?
questions.hint: 1 meter = 100 cm. Rope color and handle material don't affect conversion.

questions.question: A factory makes 150 toys per hour. The factory has 50 workers and is open 24/7. How many toys in 3 hours?
questions.hint: Multiply hourly production by hours. Worker count and hours open are irrelevant.

questions.question: Drew has 45 baseball cards. He bought them at a store downtown. He trades 18 for football cards. Baseball cards left?
questions.hint: Subtract traded cards from total. Store location doesn't affect the count.

questions.question: A gym class has 28 students. The gym floor is wooden. They form teams of 4. How many teams?
questions.hint: Divide students by team size. Floor material is irrelevant.

questions.question: Nina reads 8 books per month. Her library card is blue. How many books does she read in a year?
questions.hint: Multiply monthly reading by 12 months. Card color doesn't matter.

questions.question: A bag of chips weighs 200 g. The chips are barbecue flavored. If you eat 75 g, how much is left?
questions.hint: Subtract eaten amount from total weight. Flavor is irrelevant.

questions.question: There are 3 apple trees with 24 apples each. The orchard is family-owned. How many apples total?
questions.hint: Multiply trees by apples per tree. Ownership type doesn't affect the count.

questions.question: A theater has 15 rows with 20 seats each. The theater opened in 1923. How many seats total?
questions.hint: Multiply rows by seats per row. Opening year is irrelevant.

questions.question: Paul walks 3 km to the park. The park has a pond and playground. He walks the same way back. Total distance?
questions.hint: Add distance there and back. Park features don't affect distance.

questions.question: A jigsaw puzzle has 500 pieces. The puzzle shows a sunset. If 127 pieces are placed, how many remaining?
questions.hint: Subtract placed pieces from total. Puzzle image is irrelevant.

questions.question: Ella earns $12 per hour babysitting. She babysat twins aged 4. She worked 6 hours. How much did she earn?
questions.hint: Multiply hourly rate by hours worked. Children's ages are distractions.

questions.question: A recipe uses 4 eggs. The eggs are brown and organic. To make 3 batches, how many eggs needed?
questions.hint: Multiply eggs per batch by number of batches. Egg color and type don't matter.

questions.question: There are 16 boys and 18 girls in a class. The classroom has 8 windows. How many students total?
questions.hint: Add boys and girls together. Window count is irrelevant.

questions.question: A toy train set has 24 pieces. It was made in Germany. If shared by 3 children, how many pieces each?
questions.hint: Divide total pieces by number of children. Country of origin doesn't matter.

questions.question: A truck can carry 2,000 kg. The truck is white and has 6 wheels. If it carries 850 kg, how much more can it hold?
questions.hint: Subtract current load from capacity. Color and wheel count are distractions.

questions.question: Mia has 36 hair ties. She keeps them in a drawer. She uses 4 per day. How many days until she runs out?
questions.hint: Divide total by daily use. Storage location is irrelevant.

questions.question: A fence is 40 m long. It's wooden and painted white. If each section is 2 m, how many sections?
questions.hint: Divide total length by section length. Material and paint color don't matter.

questions.question: Sam collects 15 leaves for a project. The leaves are from maple trees. His sister collects 23. How many together?
questions.hint: Add both collections together. Tree type is irrelevant.

questions.question: A water tank holds 500 liters. The tank is metal and cylindrical. If 175 liters are used, how much remains?
questions.hint: Subtract used water from capacity. Material and shape are distractions.

questions.question: Grandma bakes 8 pies. Each pie serves 6 people. The pies are apple and cost $15 each. How many servings total?
questions.hint: Multiply pies by servings per pie. Flavor and cost don't affect servings.

questions.question: A playlist has 45 songs. Each song is 3 minutes long. The playlist was made last week. Total playlist time in minutes?
questions.hint: Multiply songs by minutes per song. When it was made is irrelevant.

questions.question: There are 72 students taking a test. The test has 50 questions. They sit in rows of 9. How many rows?
questions.hint: Divide students by seats per row. Question count doesn't affect seating.

questions.question: A plant grows 2 cm per week. The pot is terracotta. How tall will it be after 8 weeks from 0?
questions.hint: Multiply weekly growth by weeks. Pot material is irrelevant.

questions.question: Oliver has 28 crayons. The crayons are jumbo-sized. He breaks 9 of them. How many unbroken crayons?
questions.hint: Subtract broken from total. Crayon size doesn't affect the count.

questions.question: A spider has 8 legs. The spider is black and lives in the garage. If there are 7 spiders, how many legs total?
questions.hint: Multiply legs per spider by number of spiders. Color and location are distractions.

questions.question: Emily practices piano 30 minutes daily. Her piano is black and was a gift. How many minutes per week?
questions.hint: Multiply daily practice by 7 days. Piano color and source don't matter.

questions.question: A baker uses 5 cups of sugar per cake. The sugar is organic. He bakes 4 cakes. How many cups of sugar needed?
questions.hint: Multiply cups per cake by number of cakes. Sugar type is irrelevant.

questions.question: There are 54 apples in a crate. The crate is wooden and from the local farm. Split into 6 bags, how many per bag?
questions.hint: Divide total apples by number of bags. Crate material and source don't matter.

questions.question: A movie ticket costs $11. The theater has red velvet seats. If 5 friends go, what's the total cost?
questions.hint: Multiply ticket price by number of friends. Seat color and material are distractions.

questions.question: Kevin ran 400 m in a race. The track is rubber and he wore number 7. How many km is that?
questions.hint: 1 km = 1,000 m. Track material and race number are irrelevant.

questions.question: A pet store has 15 fish tanks. The store opens at 10 AM. Each tank has 8 fish. How many fish total?
questions.hint: Multiply tanks by fish per tank. Opening time doesn't affect the count.

questions.question: Sophia has $85. She wants to buy shoes that cost $62. The shoes are from Italy. How much money left after buying?
questions.hint: Subtract shoe cost from total money. Country of origin is irrelevant.

questions.question: A playground has 4 swings and 3 slides. It was renovated last summer. How many pieces of equipment total?
questions.hint: Add swings and slides together. Renovation time doesn't affect the count.

questions.question: A rectangle is 15 m long and 8 m wide. It's marked with orange cones. What is the area?
questions.hint: Area = length times width. Cone color doesn't affect the calculation.

questions.question: There are 180 pages in a book. Lily reads 36 pages. The book is a mystery novel. How many pages left?
questions.hint: Subtract read pages from total. Book genre is irrelevant.

questions.question: A carton contains 24 eggs. The eggs are large size. Mom uses 7 for breakfast. How many eggs remain?
questions.hint: Subtract used eggs from total. Egg size doesn't affect the count.

questions.question: A hiker walks 6 km on Day 1 and 9 km on Day 2. The trail has beautiful views. Total distance walked?
questions.hint: Add both days' distances together. Trail scenery is irrelevant.

questions.question: An art class has 32 students. Each student needs 5 brushes. The teacher's name is Mr. Lee. Total brushes needed?
questions.hint: Multiply students by brushes per student. Teacher's name doesn't matter.

questions.question: A sandwich costs $6. The shop uses fresh bread daily. If you buy 4 sandwiches, what's the total cost?
questions.hint: Multiply price by quantity. Bread freshness doesn't affect the price.

questions.question: Ben has 72 toy soldiers. He arranges them in 8 equal rows. The soldiers are from his collection. How many per row?
questions.hint: Divide total by number of rows. Collection source is irrelevant.

questions.question: A concert lasts 2 hours. It starts at 7 PM. The band has 5 members. How many minutes is the concert?
questions.hint: Convert hours to minutes. Start time and band size don't matter.

questions.question: There are 48 candies. They come in a decorative tin. Shared equally among 8 kids, how many each?
questions.hint: Divide candies by number of kids. Container type is irrelevant.

questions.question: A rose bush has 24 roses. The roses are red and fragrant. 8 roses wilt. How many healthy roses remain?
questions.hint: Subtract wilted roses from total. Color and fragrance don't affect the count.

questions.question: Dad bought 6 liters of milk. The milk is low-fat and locally sourced. How many ml is that?
questions.hint: 1 liter = 1,000 ml. Milk type and source are distractions.

questions.question: A classroom has 7 windows. Each window has 4 panes. The windows face south. How many panes total?
questions.hint: Multiply windows by panes per window. Direction they face is irrelevant.

questions.question: Maya scores 18 points in the first half and 24 in the second. Her jersey number is 5. Total points scored?
questions.hint: Add both halves together. Jersey number doesn't affect the score.

questions.question: A rectangle has perimeter 30 cm. Its length is 10 cm. It's drawn on graph paper. What is the width?
questions.hint: Perimeter = 2(length + width). Paper type is irrelevant.

questions.question: There are 90 pages in a notebook. The notebook has a spiral binding. If used for 9 subjects, pages per subject?
questions.hint: Divide total pages by subjects. Binding type doesn't matter.

questions.question: A water bottle holds 750 ml. The bottle is reusable. If you drink 3 bottles, how much water total?
questions.hint: Multiply bottle capacity by number of bottles. Reusability is irrelevant.

questions.question: Jack has 14 model cars. They're displayed on his shelf. He gets 9 more for Christmas. How many now?
questions.hint: Add new cars to what he had. Display location doesn't affect the count.

questions.question: A bus travels 56 km in 2 hours. The bus has comfortable seats. What is the average speed?
questions.hint: Speed = distance divided by time. Seat comfort is irrelevant.

questions.question: There are 63 marbles in a jar. The jar is glass. They're divided into 7 equal groups. How many per group?
questions.hint: Divide total by number of groups. Jar material doesn't matter.

questions.question: A field is 80 m long. The grass was mowed yesterday. A boy runs its length 3 times. Total distance run?
questions.hint: Multiply field length by number of runs. When grass was mowed is irrelevant.

questions.question: Sophie has 95 stickers. She got them as prizes. She gives 47 to her brother. How many does she keep?
questions.hint: Subtract given away from total. How she got them doesn't matter.

questions.question: A school cafeteria serves 320 lunches. The cafeteria has 12 tables. If open 4 days, average lunches per day?
questions.hint: Divide total lunches by number of days. Table count is irrelevant.

questions.question: Tom's string is 45 cm long. The string is cotton. He needs pieces of 9 cm. How many can he cut?
questions.hint: Divide total length by piece length. String material doesn't matter.

questions.question: A cinema has 16 rows with 18 seats each. The screen is 15 meters wide. How many seats total?
questions.hint: Multiply rows by seats per row. Screen size is irrelevant.

questions.question: Lily has 38 colored pencils. Her pencil case is pink. She loses 12 pencils. How many left?
questions.hint: Subtract lost pencils from total. Case color doesn't affect the count.

questions.question: A bag of rice weighs 5 kg. The rice is basmati. If you buy 7 bags, what's the total weight?
questions.hint: Multiply weight per bag by number of bags. Rice type is irrelevant.

questions.question: There are 8 teams in a league. Each team has 11 players. The league was formed in 2010. Total players?
questions.hint: Multiply teams by players per team. League formation year doesn't matter.

questions.question: A cube has sides of 4 cm. It's made of wood. What is the volume?
questions.hint: Volume of cube = side times side times side. Material is irrelevant.

questions.question: Maria reads 25 pages before dinner and 18 after. The book has a blue cover. Total pages read today?
questions.hint: Add pages read before and after dinner. Cover color doesn't matter.

questions.question: A toy costs $8. The toy store is on Oak Avenue. If Emma buys 7 toys, how much does she spend?
questions.hint: Multiply price by quantity. Store location is irrelevant.

questions.question: A garden hose is 20 m long. It's green and made of rubber. Connected to a 5 m extension, total length?
questions.hint: Add hose length and extension length. Color and material don't matter.

questions.question: There are 144 eggs. The eggs came from free-range chickens. Packed in dozens, how many cartons?
questions.hint: Divide total eggs by 12 (a dozen). Chicken source is irrelevant.

questions.question: A car park has 5 floors with 45 spaces each. It's located downtown. Total parking spaces?
questions.hint: Multiply floors by spaces per floor. Location doesn't affect capacity.

questions.question: Tim types 40 words per minute. His keyboard is wireless. How many words in 15 minutes?
questions.hint: Multiply words per minute by number of minutes. Keyboard type is irrelevant.

questions.question: A photo album has 25 pages. Each page holds 4 photos. The album is leather-bound. Total photos it can hold?
questions.hint: Multiply pages by photos per page. Album material doesn't matter.

questions.question: There are 180 minutes in 3 hours. A class meets at Room 101. If the class is 45 minutes, how many fit in 3 hours?
questions.hint: Divide total minutes by class length. Room number is irrelevant.

questions.question: A box has 36 donuts. The donuts are glazed. Divided among 9 people, how many each?
questions.hint: Divide total donuts by number of people. Donut type doesn't matter.

questions.question: Anna buys fabric that is 8 m long. The fabric is cotton and blue. She uses 3 m. How much is left?
questions.hint: Subtract used fabric from total. Material and color are distractions.

questions.question: A basketball team scores 48 points in a game. The arena seats 5,000. If 6 players scored equally, points each?
questions.hint: Divide total points by number of players. Arena capacity is irrelevant.

questions.question: A truck delivers 250 boxes. Each box weighs 4 kg. The truck is red. Total weight of boxes?
questions.hint: Multiply boxes by weight per box. Truck color doesn't affect weight.

questions.question: There are 72 students in the auditorium. The auditorium has blue chairs. They sit in 8 equal rows. How many per row?
questions.hint: Divide students by number of rows. Chair color is irrelevant.

questions.question: A snail moves 3 cm per minute. The snail has a brown shell. How far does it travel in 20 minutes?
questions.hint: Multiply speed by time. Shell color doesn't affect movement.

questions.question: A fruit basket has 8 apples, 6 oranges, and 4 bananas. The basket is wicker. How many fruits total?
questions.hint: Add all the fruits together. Basket material is irrelevant.
